intro: Eclipta heterophylla, commonly known as the variable false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and alternate leaves that vary in shape depending on environmental conditions. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open areas such as roadsides and fields. Eclipta heterophylla is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
